definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Eddie comes to school by school bus .
Don't play in the street while waiting for the school bus.
sentences.chinese: 不要在街上邊玩邊等候校車。

sentences.english: Our school bus rolled along the highway.
sentences.chinese: 我們的校車在公路上行駛。

sentences.english: I was late for the school bus and rushing to get ready.
sentences.chinese: 我晚了，急急忙忙地準備着趕校車。

sentences.english: The school-bus came ahead of time, and Mary was not ready.
sentences.chinese: 校車提前來了，瑪麗還沒有準備好。

sentences.english: Kevin and his friend Katie climbed onto the school bus, heading for the Pumpkin Patch.
sentences.chinese: 凱文和他的朋儕凱蒂登上校車，爲帕姆普金帕奇標題。

sentences.english: The school bus was fulled of the students this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上，那部校車擠滿了學生。

sentences.english: It was empty and the door was smeared with blood.
sentences.chinese: 那校車早已空了，車門上染滿了血污。

sentences.english: One day, I miss the school bus.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我沒有趕上校車。

sentences.english: This report focuses on observations of student behaviour during school bus rides.
sentences.chinese: 本報告重點介紹觀察乘坐校車的學生的行爲後的發現。

sentences.english: Special primary school were FAW Car and SAIC Iveco school bus.
sentences.chinese: 分別是一汽專用小學生校車和上汽依維柯校車。

sentences.english: Special primary school were FAW Car and SAIC Iveco school bus.
sentences.chinese: 分別是一汽專用小學生校車和上汽依維柯校車。

sentences.english: That afternoon, I jumped out of the bus and dashed up the driveway.
sentences.chinese: 那天下午，我跳下校車後，快步沿車道跑着。

sentences.english: Katie drove on past a school bus.
sentences.chinese: 卡蒂將車開過一輛校車。

sentences.english: They are hit in the "danger zone" around the bus.
sentences.chinese: 他們通常是站在校車“危險區域”周圍被撞倒。

sentences.english: School bus drivers need to accept the traffic administrative department of the public security organ for inspection every year.
sentences.chinese: 校車駕駛人每年需接受公安機關交通管理部門的審驗。

definition: Hong Kong LRT (Light Rail Transit) (abbr. for 輕便鐵路|轻便铁路)
aerial work platform (e.g. cherry picker or scissor lift)/lift/elevator
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
to access/to transfer passengers between two railway lines
to attend school as a day student
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
